Detailed Description

A 3D B-field map defined as a grid of points with associated B-field values.

Note:
Values are interpolated to obtain B-field information at points in between.

The header format of the input data file is as follows:

1) Blank line

2) int int int

Number of X, Y, and Z grid points (N_x, N_y, N_z)

3-8) int String

A description of fields in the lines of the map. In our case it is literally:

1 X 2 Y 3 Z 4 BX 5 BY 6 BZ

9) int String

Header terminator

10+) float float float float float float

N_x*N_y*N_z+9

x y z B_x B_y B_z

Original PurgMagTabulatedField3D code developed by: S.Larsson and J. Generowicz.

Definition at line 60 of file MagneticFieldMap3D.h.

00132 
00133             // Position of given point within region, normalized to the range
00134             // [0,1]

00136             double yfraction = (y - miny_) / dy_;
00137             double zfraction = (z - minz_) / dz_;

00139             if (invertX_) {
00140                 xfraction = 1 - xfraction;

00149             // Need addresses of these to pass to modf below.

00151             double xdindex, ydindex, zdindex;

00153             // Position of the point within the cuboid defined by the
00154             // nearest surrounding tabulated points
00155             double xlocal = (std::modf(xfraction * (nx_ - 1), &xdindex));
00156             double ylocal = (std::modf(yfraction * (ny_ - 1), &ydindex));
00157             double zlocal = (std::modf(zfraction * (nz_ - 1), &zdindex));
